name: ritualistically
content:

in a way that is connected with or like a ritual (= a set of fixed actions, especially ones performed as part of a ceremony): She ritualistically burned all of his letters. They ritualistically insist on using only certain entrances to the building. See
ritual
More examplesFewer examplesHe automatically, almost ritualistically, tidies up wherever he is.Some momentous events, such as divorce, are not publicly and ritualistically marked.She was ritualistically washing her hands and arranging the plates to calm her nerves.
